q: What does ORM stand for in Laravel's Eloquent ORM?
Which class do all Eloquent models extend?
What is the convention for the table name of a model named `Flight`?
How do you override the default table name in a Model?
What is the default primary key column name assumed by Eloquent?
If your primary key is not an auto-incrementing integer, which property should you set to false?
If your primary key is a string (e.g., UUID), what property should you set?
Which property overrides the default primary key name?
By default, Eloquent expects which two timestamp columns?
How do you disable automatic timestamps in a Model?
How to retrieve ALL records from the `flights` table via Flight model?
How to retrieve a record by its primary key?
What does `Flight::findOrFail(1)` do if the record doesn't exist?
How to create a new record and save it to the database?
What method creates and saves a model in one line (Mass Assignment)?
To use Mass Assignment (`create`, `update`), what property must be defined?
What does `$fillable = ['name']` mean?
o: Only the 'name' attribute can be mass assigned.
The 'name' attribute is hidden from JSON.

q: What does `$guarded = []` mean?
How to update a retrieved model instance?
How to delete a model instance?
How to delete a record by ID without retrieving it first?
What feature allows records to be 'deleted' without removing them from the database?
What Trait must be used to enable Soft Deletes?
Which column is added for Soft Deletes?
How to include soft deleted models in a query?
How to restore a soft deleted model?
What relationship is defined by `return $this->hasOne(Phone::class);`?
What relationship is defined by `return $this->belongsTo(User::class);`?
o: Inverse of One-to-One or Many-to-One (The child belongs to a parent)

q: What relationship is defined by `return $this->hasMany(Comment::class);`?
To define Many-to-Many, which method is used?
In a Many-to-Many relationship (User <-> Role), what is the intermediate table name convention?
o: role_user (Alphabetical order of singular model names)

q: How to retrieve the first model matching the conditions?
How to refresh a model instance with fresh data from the database?
What is an Accessor?
o: A method to transform an attribute value when retrieving it (e.g., `getFirstNameAttribute`).
A method to set an attribute value

q: What is a Mutator?
o: A method to transform an attribute value before saving it (e.g., `setFirstNameAttribute`).
A method to change database schema

q: New Syntax (Laravel 9+): How to define Accessor/Mutator?
o: protected function name(): Attribute { return Attribute::make(get: fn ($val) => ...); }

q: What is a Local Scope?
o: A method prefix `scope` (e.g. `scopeActive`) that allows reusable query constraints (`Flight::active()`).

q: How to apply a Global Scope to a model?
How to remove a Global Scope from a query?
What does `Flight::chunk(200, function ($flights) { ... })` do?
o: Retrieves small chunks of records at a time (memory efficient for large datasets).

q: What is the return type of `Flight::all()`?
How to verify if a model instance exists in the database by checking `exists` property?
How to specific dynamic connection for a model query?
What does `$flight->wasChanged('name')` check?
o: Checks if the attributes were changed in the very last save operation.

q: What does `$flight->isDirty('name')` check?
o: Checks if the attribute has been modified since retrieval but not yet saved.
Checks if name contains bad words

q: How to get the original value of an attribute before it was changed?
How to serialize a model to JSON?
How to serialize a model to Array?
Which property hides attributes from Array/JSON serialization?
Which property exposes computed accessors in Array/JSON serialization?
How to convert a standard query builder instance to an Eloquent query?
What method creates a model if it doesn't exist, otherwise returns it?
What method instantiates a new model instance if not found (but doesn't save yet)?
How to increment a numeric column?
How to decrement a numeric column?
What does `updateOrCreate` do?
o: Updates an existing record if matching keys are found, otherwise creates a new one.

q: How to cast an attribute to a specific type immediately on access?
Common default cast types supported by Eloquent?
o: integer, real, float, double, decimal:digits, string, boolean, object, array, collection, date, datetime, timestamp

q: What handles the 'Array' cast?
o: Automatically deserializes JSON from database into a PHP array, and serializes array to JSON on save.

q: How to use a custom collection for a specific model?
What relationship handles `MorphTo`?
o: It is the inverse of a polymorphic relationship (belongs to 'Post' or 'Video').

q: Standard columns for a polymorphic relation `imageable`?
How to eager load relationships to avoid N+1 problem?
How to eager load nested relationships?
How to constrain an eager load?
Lazy Eager Loading: How to load a relationship AFTER the model is retrieved?
How do you check if a relationship is already loaded?
How to query based on relationship existence (Has constraints)?
How to query based on relationship ABSENCE?
How to query specific columns in relationship (whereHas)?
How to count the number of related models without loading them?
What is `touch()` used for?
o: It updates the `updated_at` timestamp of the model to now.

q: What property updates parent timestamps when child is updated?
How to insert related models using `save`?
How to Attach a Many-to-Many relationship (Pivot)?
How to Detach a Many-to-Many relationship?
How to Sync Many-to-Many (replace all existing with new list)?
Is the result of `Flight::find(1)` an array or object?
Can you use UUIDs as primary keys?
o: Yes, requires `$incrementing = false`, `$keyType = 'string'` and often a trait/boot method to generate UUID on creation.
Yes, strictly handled by database trigger

q: What is `replicate()`?
o: Clones the model instance into a new non-existing instance. `$copy = $flight->replicate(); $copy->save();`

q: What is `withoutEvents()`?
o: Executes a callback without firing any model events (creating, saving, etc.).

q: Does `belongsTo` work with non-standard foreign keys?
How to specify database connection name in model?
What method returns the Query Builder underlying the Model?
o: toBase() (Not standard Eloquent method on model instance, but `getQuery()` exists internally). `Flight::toBase()` starts a raw DB query.

q: How to debug the SQL query generated by Eloquent builder?
o: Flight::where(...)->toSql() (returns string only) or `dd()` / `dump()` in newer Laravel query chains.

q: Basic: Can a Model extend another Model class?
o: Yes, typically useful for Single Table Inheritance patterns or shared logic.

q: What methods are fired during Model Lifecycle?
o: retrieved, creating, created, updating, updated, saving, saved, deleting, deleted, restoring, restored, replicate

q: Where is the best place to register Model Event listeners simply?
o: In the `booted` (or `boot`) static method of the Model.

q: Does `delete()` on a Builder (mass delete) fire `deleting/deleted` model events?
o: No, mass delete query doesn't retrieve models, so no events fired. Use iteration to fire events.

q: What is `prunable` trait used for?
o: Automatically deleting outdated models via scheduled command `model:prune`.

q: How to compare two models are the same row?
What does `Model::preventLazyLoading()` do?
o: Strict mode: Throws exception if you try to access a relationship that wasn't eager loaded. (Good for dev)

q: Can you use Eloquent without Laravel framework (e.g. Slim)?
o: Yes, `illuminate/database` package can be used standalone.

q: Introduction: Are Eloquent Models Active Record implementation?
What is `hasManyThrough` used for?
o: Accessing a distant relationship through an intermediate model (e.g., Country has many Posts through Users).

q: Syntax for `hasManyThrough`?
What is `hasOneThrough`?
o: Accessing a single distant record through an intermediate model (e.g. Mechanic has one CarOwner through Car repairs... no wait, e.g. Supplier has one History through Account).

q: What is a Polymorphic Relationship?
o: A model can belong to more than one other type of model on a single association (e.g. Comments can belong to both Posts and Videos).

q: In a polymorphic relationship `morphTo`, what two columns are required on the child table?
o: A 'type' column (string class name) and an 'id' column (integer/uuid).

q: What relationship method defines the Parent side of a 1:1 polymorphic relation (e.g. User has one Image)?
What relationship method defines the Parent side of a 1:N polymorphic relation (e.g. Post has many Comments)?
What relationship method defines the Child side (e.g. Comment belongs to Post OR Video)?
o: morphTo() (Name usually inferred from method name, e.g. `commentable`)

q: How to handle Many-to-Many Polymorphic relations (e.g. Tags on Posts and Videos)?
In Many-to-Many Polymorphic, which side uses `morphedByMany`?
o: The inverse side (e.g. Tag model uses `morphedByMany(Post::class, 'taggable')`).

q: What is the convention for the pivot table in Many-to-Many Polymorphic?
o: Plural of the morph name (e.g. `taggables`). Columns: `tag_id`, `taggable_id`, `taggable_type`.

q: How to query non-static global scopes?
o: Global scopes are usually classes implementing `Scope`. Using Closures in `boot` is also common.

q: Dynamic Scopes: How to define a scope that accepts parameters?
How to call a dynamic scope?
What is an Model Observer?
o: A class that groups event listeners for a model (creating, saved, deleted, etc.).

q: How to register an Observer?
o: In `EventServiceProvider` setup or `Model::observe(Observer::class)` in a ServiceProvider boot method.

q: Can you mute events for a single operation?
What is `saveQuietly()`?
o: Saves the model without firing any events. (Available in recent Laravel versions).

q: Collections: What does `each` do?
o: Iterates over items. If callback returns false, stops iteration. Returns original collection.

q: Collections: What does `map` do?
o: Iterates and returns a NEW collection with modified items.

q: Collections: What does `transform` do?
o: Iterates and modifies the collection *in place* (mutates it).

q: Collections: `pluck('name', 'id')`?
o: Returns collection of values keyed by the second argument (e.g. [1 => 'Alice', 2 => 'Bob']).

q: Collections: `filter` vs `reject`?
o: Filter keeps items where callback is true. Reject removes items where callback is true.

q: Higher Order Messages in Collections?
o: Short syntax for actions on objects. `$users->each->markAsActive()` instead of closure.

q: What is `Date Casting` format customization?
What is `Attribute Casting` (Custom Casts)?
o: Classes implementing `CastsAttributes` interface to handle complex get/set logic (e.g. encrypted fields, value objects).

q: How to make a custom cast class?
What is `Model::query()` equivalent to?
o: Used to start a query chain cleanly from static context. Equivalent to `(new Model)->newQuery()`.

q: Difference between `destroy(1)` and `delete()`?
o: Destroy takes ID(s) and deletes them (retrieves then deletes to fire events). Delete is called on an instance or query builder (if builder, no events).

q: How to force a hard delete on a SoftDeleted model?
What does `latest()` scope do?
What does `oldest()` scope do?
What is `inRandomOrder()`?
o: Randomizes results (DB specific, e.g. ORDER BY RAND()). High performance cost on large tables.

q: How to retrieve the SQL for a relationship query?
Accessors: If column is `first_name`, what is the legacy accessor method name?
Mutators: If column is `first_name`, what is the legacy mutator method name?
Do Accessors affect database queries?
o: No, they compute values after retrieval. You cannot `where` on an accessor directly (unless you use raw SQL or stored generated columns).

q: How to append an accessor to the JSON output of a model?
o: Add its snake_case name to `$appends` property. e.g. `protected $appends = ['full_name'];`

q: Factory: How to generate 10 fake users?
Difference between `create()` and `make()` in Factory?
o: Create saves to DB. Make creates instances in memory (not saved).

q: How to override attributes in Factory?
How to define state methods in Factory (e.g. `suspended`)?
o: Return a modified state array. `public function suspended() { return $this->state(fn() => ['status' => 'suspended']); }`

q: What is Database Seeding?
o: Populating database with initial/dummy data using Seeders (often calling Factories).

q: Command to run seeders?
How to call specific seeder class?
How to refresh migration and seed?
What is `Pivot` model?
o: A model representing the intermediate table in Many-to-Many. Extends `Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\Pivot`.

q: How to use a custom Pivot model?
How to retrieve extra columns from pivot table?
How to automatically add timestamps to pivot table?
Accessing pivot data in foreach loop?
Renaming the pivot accessor (default `pivot`)?
What is `touches()` used for in relationships?
o: Updating parent's timestamp when child changes. defined in child model.

q: Querying relationship absence with constraints?
o: Flight::whereDoesntHave('passengers', function($q){ $q->where('vip', true); })->get() (Flights without VIP passengers)

q: Counting related models on retrieval `withCount` result attribute?
How to alias `withCount`?
What does `Model::is($model)` do?
o: Checks if two models have same ID, table, and connection.
Checks if objects are identical instance

q: Can you mass assign `created_at`?
o: Yes, if in `$fillable` (or if unguarding). Eloquent will respect passed value instead of auto-setting it.

q: How to make sure a unique rule ignores the current user during update?
What is `getForeignKey()` on a model?
o: Returns the default foreign key name (snake_case_id). e.g. `user_id`.

q: What is `getKey()`?
o: Returns the value of the primary key.

q: What does `fresh()` do vs `refresh()`?
o: Fresh returns a NEW instance with data from DB. Refresh hydrates the EXISTING instance in-place.

q: Can you use Eloquent with MongoDB?
o: Yes, via community package `jenssegers/mongodb` (extends Eloquent). Not built-in primarily.

q: What is `Cross Database` relationship?
o: Possible if connection is defined or table name includes database prefix. Eloquent handles it if configured.

q: Does Eloquent support composite primary keys?
o: Not natively fully supported for all features (like `save`, `find`). Requires custom traits or workaround packages.

q: What is `$visible` property?
o: Allowlist for array/JSON serialization. If set, ONLY these attributes are shown. (Opposite of hidden).

q: What happens if both `$hidden` and `$visible` are set?
How to set default values for attributes in Model?
Are default values in `$attributes` applied on `new Model`?
o: Yes, immediately available on new instance.

q: How to clone a query builder?
Why clone a query builder?
o: To run multiple queries (e.g. `count` then `get`) from the same base constraints without modifying the original object state (since builder is mutable).

q: What is `sole()` method?
o: Retrieves exactly one record. Throws exception if no records found (ModelNotFound) OR if multiple records found (MultipleRecordsFound).

q: When to use `sole()`?
o: When you expect uniqueness logically but DB constraint might not enforce it, and want to fail hard if duplicate data exists.

q: What is an Anonymous Global Scope?
o: Using a closure in `boot` method: `static::addGlobalScope('name', function($q){...})`

q: Can you extend the Eloquent Builder?
o: Yes, by overriding `newEloquentBuilder($query)` in Model and returning custom builder instance.

q: Benefit of Custom Eloquent Builder?
o: Methods correspond to business logic on the builder itself (`User::whereActive()`) instead of scopes, offering better IDE completion and organization.

q: Difference between `belongsToMany` and `hasMany`?
o: belongsToMany uses a pivot table (Many-to-Many). hasMany uses a foreign key on the other model (One-to-Many).

q: How to order results by a relationship count?
Is `Model::all()` lazy or eager loading?
o: It loads only the model records. Relationships are lazy-loaded when accessed, unless `$with` property is set on model.

q: What effect does `protected $with = ['relation'];` have?
o: Auto-eager loads 'relation' every time the model is queried.

q: Can you disable `$with` auto-loading?
Eloquent `value('column')`?
o: Gets the value of a single column from the first result.

q: Eloquent `pluck('column')`?
o: Gets a Collection of all values for that column.

q: What is `c` in CRUD (Eloquent context)?
Intermediate: What does `Model::unguard()` do?
o: Temporarily disables mass assignment protection globally (usually used in seeders).

q: How to re-enable guarding?
What is an Eloquent API Resource?
o: A transformation layer between Eloquent models and JSON responses (extends `JsonResource`).

q: How to generate a Resource?
Which method in a Resource defines the array structure?
How to return a collection of resources?
Difference between `JsonResource` and `ResourceCollection`?
o: JsonResource represents a single model. ResourceCollection represents a collection of models.

q: How to create a dedicated Resource Collection class?
How to conditionally include an attribute in a Resource?
How to conditionally include a relationship only if loaded?
What is `preserveKeys` property in a Resource?
o: If true, preserves the original keys of the collection (doesn't reset to numerical indices).

q: How to wrap the JSON response in a specific key (e.g. 'data')?
o: It is wrapped in 'data' by default. Can customize via `public $wrap = 'user';` property.

q: How to remove the 'data' wrapper globally?
How to add top-level meta data (pagination links etc) to a Resource response?
o: Override `with($request)` method or use `additional(['meta' => ...])` method when returning.

q: Advanced: What is a `MorphMap` used for?
o: Decouples the database internal structure from class names in polymorphic columns. Maps 'post' string to 'App\Models\Post'.

q: Where to register `Relation::morphMap`?
What is the benefit of `morphMap`?
o: If you rename your model class, data in DB (polymorphic 'type' column) remains valid.

q: How to query JSON columns: `whereJsonContains`?
How to query JSON length?
Query Builder: What does `when($condition, callback)` do?
o: Executes the callback query modification ONLY if condition is truthy. (Cleaner than if/else blocks).

q: Query Builder: `tap($callback)`?
o: Executes the callback with the query builder instance, then returns the builder instance. Useful for inspecting or side-effects without breaking chain.

q: Subqueries: `addSelect`?
o: Adds columns to the existing select clause (useful if adding subquery columns).

q: How to select the latest login date from a related Login model as a column?
Ordering by a subquery?
What is `whereColumn`?
o: Compares two columns within the database (e.g. `updated_at` > `created_at`).

q: Is `whereColumn('first_name', 'last_name')` checking equality?
o: Yes, checks if first_name equals last_name in the same row.
No, checks if columns are different

q: How to retrieve models by their primary keys (array)?
What if some IDs in `find([1, 2, 3])` are missing?
o: It returns only the found models.

q: What is `findMany`?
How to execute raw SQL efficiently if needed?
Difference between `whereRaw` and `where`?
o: whereRaw accepts a raw SQL string for the WHERE clause (be careful of SQL injection!). `where` constructs it safely.

q: How to group query conditions (bracket logic)?
What is `orWhere`?
o: Adds an OR condition to the query.

q: Can you use `orWhere` inside a scoped closure?
o: Yes, commonly used to create groups like `WHERE status = 1 AND (subscribed = 1 OR trial = 1)`.

q: What is `modelKeys()` on a Collection?
o: Returns an array of primary keys for all models in the collection.

q: How to reload parent model from a child model?
o: $comment->post->fresh() or access relationship again if not cached.

q: Does `belongsTo` support default models if relation is null?
o: Yes, `->withDefault()` on the relationship definition returns empty instance (or array of attributes) instead of null.

q: How to constrain a `belongsTo` eager load?
What is `whereKey($id)`?
o: Adds a where clause on the primary key column (handles composite keys too).

q: What is `whereKeyNot($id)`?
o: Exclude records with given primary key(s).

q: Scopes: Can a scope return values other than the builder?
o: No, local scopes should generally return `void` or the Builder instance implicitly. If you return something else, query chaining breaks.

q: How to remove all global scopes?
How to remove only specific global scopes?
Comparing Models: `isNot($model)`?
o: Checks if two models are NOT the same (ID, table, connection).

q: Does `save()` return boolean?
Does `push()` save the model and its relationships?
o: Yes, saves the model and all its loaded relationships.

q: How to duplicate a model instance in memory without saving?
Can `replicate` exclude specific attributes?
o: Yes, pass array of keys to ignore: `$flight->replicate(['token'])`

q: What is `Route Route Binding` customization in Model?
o: Override `getRouteKeyName()` to use 'slug' instead of 'id' for validation/retrieval in routes.

q: How to customize Route Binding query logic?
Preventing accidental updates in Production methods?
Strict Mode (Laravel 9.35+): Enaling all safety checks?
o: Model::shouldBeStrict() (Enables lazy loading prevention, unfillable guarding, missing attribute checks).

q: Where to enable Model strict mode?
Relationship: `hasOne` syntax?
Relationship: `belongsToMany` custom table name?
Relationship: `belongsToMany` custom keys?
o: 3rd arg (foreign key of current model), 4th arg (foreign key of related model).

q: What is `latestOfMany`?
o: A `hasOne` or `morphOne` relation that retrieves the *latest* related model from a `hasMany` relation efficiently.

q: Syntax for `latestOfMany`?
Can `latestOfMany` sort by other columns?
What is `oldestOfMany`?
Eloquent `chunkById` vs `chunk`?
o: chunkById orders by ID and is safe when updating records in a way that affects chunking (e.g. updating timestamp). chunk uses offset/limit.

q: When processing massive datasets for update, which is better?
Cursor: `Flight::cursor()`?
o: Returns a LazyCollection backed by a Generator. Executing single query and yielding results one by one (low memory usage).

q: What method on Collection converts it to regular array?
What is `dump()` in query chain?
o: Dumps the query bindings and SQL, then continues chain.

q: What is `dd()` in query chain?
o: Dump and Die. Shows SQL/bindings and exits.

q: Does `update()` on a model instance require a `save()`?
Does `fill()` save the model?
o: No. `$tweet->fill(['text' => 'New']);` only sets attributes. Must call `save()`.

q: What happens if you set a non-fillable attribute via `fill`?
o: It is silently discarded (unless guarding is disabled).

q: What is `$dispatchesEvents` property?
o: Maps Model lifecycle events to custom Event classes. `protected $dispatchesEvents = ['saved' => UserSaved::class];`

q: How to handle database transactions with Model callbacks?
o: Use `DB::transaction(...)`. No specific model method, but events fire within transaction.

q: What is `forceFill`?
Intermediate: Can you cast to `encrypted`?
Cast to `collection`?
Cast to `immutable_date`?
Serialization: How to customize date format globally for JSON?
What is `makeHidden` used for?
o: Excludes attributes from serialization dynamically on a collection or instance. `$users->makeHidden('email');`

q: What is `makeVisible`?
o: Includes attributes that are usually hidden. `$user->makeVisible('api_token');`

q: Can you use `makeHidden` on a Collection?
o: Yes, it propagates to all models in collection.

q: Query: `whereBetween`?
Query: `whereNotBetween`?
Query: `whereIn`?
Query: `whereNull`?
Does `update()` return the number of affected rows?
Does `delete()` return number of deleted rows?
Pruning: How to customize pruning query?
o: Implement `prunable` method returning a builder. `return static::where('created_at', '<', now()->subMonth());`

q: When does pruning happen?
What is `CastsAttributes` interface used for?
o: Creating custom cast classes for Eloquent attributes (implements `get` and `set`).

q: Custom Cast: What parameters does `get` method receive?
How to cast a value to an Object / ValueObject?
o: Use a custom cast class that hydrates the ValueObject in `get` and extracts primitives in `set`.

q: What is `InboundCast`?
o: A custom cast that only mutates data for storage (one-way). Implements `CastsInboundAttributes`.

q: Event: `replicating`?
o: Fired when a model is replicated using `replicate()`. Allows modifying the cloned instance before it is returned.

q: Event: `discarded`?
o: Fired when a model is soft deleted and then force deleted? No, actually fired when a model is Discarded by `Model::preventSilentlyDiscardingAttributes` violation? No. It's not a standard lifecycle event.
Does not exist as standard event

q: Testing: `assertModelExists($model)`?
o: Asserts that the model exists in the database.

q: Testing: `assertModelMissing($model)`?
o: Asserts that the model does NOT exist in the database.

q: Testing: `assertSoftDeleted($model)`?
o: Asserts the model exists but has a non-null `deleted_at`.

q: Unique validation ignoring soft deleted records?
Relationship: `whereBelongsTo($model)`?
o: Post::whereBelongsTo($user)->get() (Automatically determines foreign key column based on model/relation).

q: Can `whereBelongsTo` handle collections?
o: Yes, pass a collection of models to verify if it belongs to ANY of them (Where In).

q: What is `withoutTouch()`?
o: Executes a callback preventing the model from touching its relationships/timestamps. `$post->withoutTouch(fn() => $post->save());`

q: How to override keys used for save query (Updates)?
o: protected function setKeysForSaveQuery($query) { ... } (Important for composite keys support).

q: What is `originalIsEquivalent($key)`?
o: Checks if the current attribute value is equivalent to the original value (handling loose comparison logic).

q: Queues: `SerializesModels` trait?
o: When a job with this trait is queued, it saves the ID of the model property. When dequeued, it automatically fetches the fresh model from DB.

q: What happens if a queued model is deleted before job runs?
o: ModelNotFoundException is thrown (job fails). Can be caught with `deleteWhenMissingModels` property.

q: How to verify if two models are logically equivalent (all attributes)?
o: No built-in method, must compare `toArray()`. `is()` only checks Identity (ID/Table).

q: What is `getMorphClass()`?
o: Returns the class name for polymorphic storage (or the mapped string if `morphMap` is used).

q: How to constrain a query to models created today?
How to constrain to created in current month?
Using `create` with relationships?
o: Not directly supported on the parent `create`. Must create parent, then `save()` child relations.

q: Can you use `firstWhere` as a shortcut?
What is `Model::preventAccessingMissingAttributes()`?
o: Strict Mode: Throws exception when accessing an attribute that was not retrieved in the query (SELECT specific columns).

q: How to mass-update records?
Does mass-update fire `saving` / `saved` events?
o: No, it runs a direct UPDATE query. No models are hydrated.

q: How to insert multiple records efficiently (one query)?
Does `insert` fire created events?
What is `createMany` used for?
o: A relationship method. `$user->posts()->createMany([['title'=>'A'], ['title'=>'B']])`. Fires events for each.

q: How to toggle a boolean column?
o: No direct Eloquent method. Must do `$user->active = !$user->active; $user->save();` or `update(['active' => DB::raw('NOT active')])`.

q: How to check if model uses SoftDeletes trait dynamically?
What is `resolveChildRouteBinding`?
o: Method to customize implicit scoping of child bindings (Nested Resources).

q: Can you use standard PHP Enums in Eloquent (Laravel 9+)?
When casting to Enum, what happens if DB value is invalid?
o: Throws a ValueError (PHP standard behavior for backing enums) or Exception upon retrieval context.

q: How to encrypt a column without custom cast?
Does `encrypted` cast support array/json?
What is `Model::withoutTimestamps` callback?
Can you define `const` in Model class?
o: Yes, helpful for defining fixed status values or types.

q: How to specify default ordering for all queries of a model?
o: Add a global scope in `booted`. `static::addGlobalScope('order', fn($q) => $q->orderBy('name'));`

q: Are Accessors cached?
o: No, computed every time accessed. `CastsAttributes` can cache values if implemented manually.

q: How to make a `Virtual Attribute` (Attribute that doesn't exist in DB)?
o: Just define an Accessor. You can pass values to it via constructor or setters, but it won't save unless mapped to a real column.

q: Lazy Loading Violation: What exception is threw?
How to silently discard non-fillable attributes?
o: It is the default behavior. To prevent it (throw exception), use `Model::preventSilentlyDiscardingAttributes()`.

q: Can you use `DB::raw` in `orderBy`?
What is `Model::on('connection')`?
o: Static method to begin query on a specific connection.

q: How to get the database connection object instance from a model?
What is `from` method used for?
o: Specifies the table to select from (overriding `$table`). `User::select('field')->from('archive_users')->get()`.

q: How to force an index in query?
o: MySQL: `->from(DB::raw('users USE INDEX (my_index)'))` or specific driver hints.

q: Where should you place complex query logic?
o: In Query Scopes or specialized Builder classes. Not in Controllers.

q: What is a `Scope` interface?
o: Interface for defining Global Scopes. `apply(Builder $builder, Model $model)`.

q: Can you `join` in Eloquent?
Downside of using `join` in Eloquent?
o: You effectively get a raw result set (attributes overlap). Returned instances might be 'User' models but contain 'Post' columns. And `with` eager loading might not work as expected if primary keys are ambiguous.

q: How to avoid column collision in joins?
o: Select specific columns with aliases. `select('users.*', 'posts.title as post_title')`.

q: Eloquent: `upsert`?
Arguments for `upsert`?
o: Values(array of arrays), UniqueBy(columns to check uniqueness), Update(columns to update if exists).

q: Is `upsert` atomic?
o: Yes, typically implemented as `INSERT ... ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE` (MySQL) or similar atomic DB instruction.

q: How to prevent updating the `updated_at` column during save?
What is `touch` on a relationship?
o: `$user->posts()->touch()` update updated_at of all related posts.

q: How to get the 'raw' attribute value (skipping accessor)?
What is `$model->wasRecentlyCreated`?
o: Boolean. True if the model was inserted during the current request lifecycle.

q: How to define a default value for a column in migration?
If migration has default, do you need `$attributes` in Model?
o: Not strictly. But if you create a `new Model` instance in PHP, it won't have the default value until you save/refresh from DB. Using `$attributes` keeps them in sync in memory.

q: How to paginate Eloquent results?
What does `simplePaginate` do?
o: Pagination with only 'Next' and 'Previous' links (saves count(*) query).

q: How to customize the pagination view?
How to append query string parameters to pagination links?
Where does `paginate()` get the current page number?
o: Automatically from the `?page` query string parameter in the Request.

q: How to use a different query parameter for page number?
Does `cursorPaginate` allow jumping to page 10?
o: No, it assumes strict sequential access (next/prev) based on a cursor string.

q: Benefit of `cursorPaginate`?
o: Extreme performance for large datasets (infinite scroll) as it avoids OFFSET/LIMIT slow-down.

q: Can you eager load with `cursorPaginate`?
How to check if a collection is empty?
How to check if model uses timestamps?
How to get the table name of a model instance?
How to get the qualified key name (table.id)?
What is `setConnection` used for?
o: Change the connection of a model instance at runtime. `$model->setConnection('mysql2');`

q: Can you use `DB::table('users')` to interact with Eloquent soft deletes?
o: No, Query Builder doesn't know about Eloquent scopes unless you manually add `whereNull('deleted_at')`.

q: How to chunk, but updating records to break the chunking?
o: Use `chunkById`. Standard `chunk` fails if you update the sorting column (e.g. `updated_at`).

q: What is `tap` in a Factory definition?
o: afterMaking / afterCreating hooks. `public function configure() { return $this->afterMaking(...); }`

q: Factory: `sequence`?
Factory: `has` method?
Factory: `for` method?
Can multiple `has` be chained?
How to define Accessor caching in new Attribute syntax?
What does `Model::setEventDispatcher` do?
o: Dependency injection of the dispatcher (internally used by Laravel).

q: Intermediate: What class handles Relationship definitions?
Which helper function returns a new `Fluent` object?
How to check if an attribute exists in the model's attributes array?
How to remove an attribute from the model instance?
What does `Model::unsetEventDispatcher()` do?
o: Disables all event firing for models (global effect if singleton unset). Useful for testing performance.

q: How to get the database name used by the connection?
Can you use Eloquent with Read/Write separation?
o: Yes, configured in `config/database.php`. Eloquent uses 'read' connection for select and 'write' for insert/update automatically.

q: How to force usage of 'write' connection for a select query (Sticky)?
What is `Model::hydrate($items)`?
o: Creates a collection of models from plain arrays (raw query results).

q: What is `fromQuery($sql, $bindings)`?
o: Hydrates models from a raw SQL query string.

q: How to use a Custom Collection for a specific model?
Benefit of Custom Eloquent Collection?
o: Add domain-specific methods to groups of models (e.g. `$users->markAllAsActive()`).

q: What does `$incrementing = false` do?
o: Tells Eloquent that the primary key does not auto-increment (required for UUIDs or string keys).

q: If using UUIDs, what else must you set besides `$incrementing`?
Querying Polymorphic relations: `whereHasMorph`?
Can `whereHasMorph` handle different constraints for different types?
o: Yes, pass a closure that checks `$type` or separate closures for each class.

q: Dynamic Relationship: `resolveRelationUsing`?
o: Define a relationship dynamically at runtime (useful for testing or packages). `Model::resolveRelationUsing('posts', fn($m) => ...)`

q: What is `Model::preventLazyLoading()`?
o: Prevents N+1 problem by throwing exception if a relationship is accessed without eager loading.

q: How to allow lazy loading only in production?
Attribute Casting: `mergeCasts`?
o: Merges casts with existing ones (useful in traits).

q: How to check if model has a specific cast?
What is `createQuietly`?
o: Creates a model without firing any events. (Available in recent Laravel versions).

q: Serialization: `jsonSerialize` vs `toArray`?
o: `jsonSerialize` is called when `json_encode` is used. It typically calls `toArray`. Overriding `toArray` is usually enough.

q: How to customize the `date` serialization format per attribute?
How to change the format of `created_at` and `updated_at` in JSON?
o: Use `$dateFormat` property (Changes DB format too, be careful).

q: What is the `HasBuilder` interface?
o: Allows defining a custom builder factory method `newEloquentBuilder`.
It is not an interface, just a convention

q: How to use `QualifyColumn`?
Can you use `CASE ... WHEN` in Eloquent `select`?
o: Yes, using `DB::raw` or `selectRaw`. `User::selectRaw('CASE WHEN x THEN y ELSE z END as type')->get()`.

q: What is `Model::withoutRelations()`?
o: Clones the model and unsets all loaded relationships.

q: How to check if a relationship is loaded?
What is `loadMissing`?
o: Eager loads relationships ONLY if they are not already loaded. `$user->loadMissing('posts')`.

q: Difference between `load` and `loadMissing`?
o: `load` forces a fresh query even if already loaded. `loadMissing` skips if loaded.

q: What is `loadMorph`?
o: Eager loads polymorphic relationships for a collection, handling different types efficiently.

q: How to filter `loadMorph`?
o: Pass array mapping types to closures. `loadMorph('commentable', [Post::class => fn($q) => ...])`

q: What is `Model::discardsMissingAttributes`?
o: Property/state that determines if missing attributes are ignored or throw exception (related to 'Strict Mode').

q: Can you use `cursor` with `map`?
o: Yes, returns a LazyCollection which supports `map`, `filter`, etc. without loading all to memory.

q: Difference between `LazyCollection` and `Collection`?
o: LazyCollection uses Generators (yield) to process data one by one. Collection holds all data in array in memory.

q: How to use `remember` in Eloquent (Caching)?
o: Removed in Laravel 5. Must use `Cache::remember('key', ttl, fn() => Query->get())` manually or use packages like `laravel-model-caching`.

q: What is `Relation::noConstraints(fn)`?
o: Executes callback with foreign key constraints disabled on the relation query. (Advanced usage).

q: Binding Resolution: `resolveRouteBindingQuery`?
o: Method on Model to define the base query for route binding (e.g. adding `withId` check or `withTrashed`).

q: How to make a model read-only (prevent save/update)?
o: Override `save`, `update`, `delete` to throw exception, or use a trait. No native 'read-only' property.

q: How to use `with` recursively?
o: `with('children.children')` or use common CTE packages (not native recursive loading).

q: What is `Model::isIgnoringTouch()`?
o: Checks if the model is currently in a `withoutTouch` scope.

q: Events: `retrieved`?
o: Fired after a model is retrieved from the database.

q: Can `retrieved` event mutate the model?
o: Yes, often used to calculate temporary fields after fetch.

q: How to check if model is dirty (attributes changed)?
How to check if specific attribute is dirty?
How to get original values before changes?
What is `syncOriginal()`?
o: Syncs the 'original' array with current attributes (marks model as clean). Automatically called after save.

q: Difference between `isDirty` and `wasChanged`?
o: `isDirty` checks pending changes BEFORE save. `wasChanged` checks what was updated AFTER save (in valid lifecycle).

q: What is `getChanges()`?
o: Returns array of attributes that were changed and saved in the last operation.

q: How to use `Arr::get` logic on model attributes?
o: Model doesn't support dot notation access natively for JSON columns via `->`. Need `data_get($model, 'json.key')` or accessors.

q: Can you use `where` on a generic Accessor?
o: No, because Accessors exist in PHP, not DB. (Unless using `where` on collection after fetch).

q: What is `Model::boot()`?
o: The static method where standard events and global scopes are often registered. (Called once per request per model class).

q: What is `Model::booted()`?
o: Lightweight alternative to overriding boot. Use `protected static function booted()`.

q: How to generate UUID automatically on creation?
o: Use `creating` event in `booted`: `static::creating(fn($m) => $m->id = (string) Str::uuid());` or use a Trait.
Set type to UUID in migration only

q: Intermediate: `HasAttributes` trait?
o: Trait that handles all attribute retrieval, setting, casting, and date mutation logic.

q: What is `GuardsAttributes` trait?
What is `HidesAttributes` trait?
How to check if model instance has been deleted (soft or hard)?
o: For soft: `$model->trashed()`. For hard: `$model->exists` becomes false after `delete()` (if instance kept).

q: Does `$model->exists` update after `delete()`?
How to refresh a model but lock it for update?
o: $model->refresh()->lockForUpdate() (Wait, refresh returns void/instance? `refresh` reloads. Use `User::lockForUpdate()->find($id)`). Correct: `$model = User::lockForUpdate()->find($model->id)`.

q: Shared lock syntax?
Lock for update syntax?
What is `toBase()`?
o: Returns the underlying Query Builder instance (steals generic query from Eloquent). Result is Collection of `stdClass`, not Models. Faster.

q: Why use `toBase()`?
o: Performance. Skips hydration (creating Model objects) and overhead when you only need raw data.

q: Can you use Eloquent scopes after `toBase()`?
o: No, because it returns `Illuminate\Database\Query\Builder`, which doesn't know about Model scopes.

q: How to get a raw PDO instance?
How to log all Eloquent queries?
Where to put `DB::listen`?
What is `Model::sole()` exception if not found?
What is `Model::sole()` exception if multiple found?
How to define a 'Through' relationship with custom keys?
Order of keys in `hasManyThrough`?
o: Foreign Key on Intermediate, Foreign Key on Target, Local Key on Source, Local Key on Intermediate.

q: What is `touches` array used for in Model?
o: List of relationships to touch (update timestamp) when the model is saved. `protected $touches = ['post'];` (on Comment model).

q: Can `touches` work recursively?
o: Yes, if the parent also has `$touches` defined pointing further up.

q: Intermediate: `withoutGlobalScope` vs `withoutGlobalScopes`?
o: `withoutGlobalScope` removes ONE specific scope (by class or name). `withoutGlobalScopes` removes ALL (or array of specific ones).

q: Does `Model::destroy` accept collection?
o: Yes, collection, array, or single ID.

q: How to make sure `destroy` fires events for multiple deletions?
o: It does by default! `destroy` retrieves each model and calls `delete` on it individually.

q: When using `QueryBuilder` delete (`where(...)->delete()`), do events fire?
How to force events on mass delete?
What is `Model::query()->macro(...)`?
o: Extends the Builder with custom methods dynamically.

q: How to check if a model instance is dirty (specific attributes)?
How to check if model uses the `HasFactory` trait?
What does `Model::factory()->count(3)->make()` return?
How to seed a relationship using Factory magic?
What is `Model::withoutEvents` return value?
o: The return value of the closure passed to it.

q: Can you use standard PHP Attributes for Casts in new Laravel?
o: Yes, `#[CastsWith(MyCast::class)]` (Depends on version/support). Actually typically defined in `$casts` array.

q: Advanced: `WhereMorphRelation`?
o: Querying where a morph relation satisfies condition. `whereMorphRelation('taggable', '*', ['name' => 'John'])`.

q: How to update timestamps without changing other data?
Does `touch` fire events?
o: Yes, `saved` and `updated` events (but not `saving`/`updating` sometimes, check docs? Actually yes, it saves the model).

q: How to specify a custom connection for a relationship?
o: Usually derived from the related model's connection. Can assume related model defines its connection.

q: Can you run `migrate` for a specific path?
What is `Schema::hasTable('users')`?
o: Checks if table exists in DB.

q: What is `Schema::hasColumn('users', 'email')`?
How to drop all tables?
Difference between `migrate:fresh` and `migrate:refresh`?
o: Fresh drops all tables and runs migrations. Refresh rolls back all migrations (down method) and runs them again.

q: Which is faster: `fresh` or `refresh`?
o: Fresh (usually), as it just drops tables without running per-migration logic.

q: What is `stub` publishing in Laravel?
o: php artisan stub:publish (Allows customizing the templates used by `make:` commands).

q: How to customize the default Model stub?
What is `prunable` trait?
o: Trait to automate deleting old models (Pruning).

q: What is `MassAssignable` trait?
o: Internal trait used by Model to handle fillable/guarded. (Typically not used directly).

q: Collection: `pipe` method?
o: Passes the collection to a closure and returns the result. `$collection->pipe(fn($c) => $c->sum())`.

q: Collection: `mapWithKeys`?
o: Iterates and returns an associative array (formatted as [key => value]). Useful for reshaping for dropdowns.

q: Collection: `reduce`?
o: Reduces the collection to a single value (accumulator). `reduce(fn($carry, $item) => $carry + $item, 0)`.

q: Collection: `flatMap`?
o: Maps each item to a collection/array and then collapses (flattens) them into a single collection.

q: Query: `whereRelation`?
Query: `doesntHave`?
o: Returns models that do NOT have any related records for a given relationship. `Post::doesntHave('comments')->get()`.

q: Query: `orWhereHas`?
o: Adds an OR WHERE EXISTS clause for a relationship.

q: How to enable valid query logging in memory?
Why is `DB::enableQueryLog()` disabled by default?
o: It consumes memory storing every query string and binding. Dangerous in long-running processes (workers).

q: Security: `whereRaw('id = ' . $id)`?
o: Vulnerable to SQL Injection! Always use bindings: `whereRaw('id = ?', [$id])`.

q: What does `DB::select` return?
How to perform a transaction manually?
What is `DB::transaction(closure)` benefit?
o: Automatically commits on success or rolls back if an exception is thrown inside the closure.

q: Can you use deadlock retries with `transaction`?
Model: `getIncrementing()`?
o: Returns boolean indicating if IDs are auto-incrementing.

q: Model: `getKeyName()`?
o: Returns the name of the primary key column (default 'id').

q: Model: `getForeignKey()`?
o: Get the default foreign key name for the model (e.g. `user_id`).

q: How to get the 'class name' of a related model instance in a polymorphic relation?
o: It's stored in the `*_type` column. Eloquent uses it to instantiate.

q: What is `Model::saving` event?
o: Fired BEFORE the model is saved (created or updated). Returning false cancels the save.

q: What is `Model::saved` event?
o: Fired AFTER the model is saved and transaction committed (usually).

q: If `creating` event returns false, does `saving` event fire?
o: Order is: saving -> creating -> created -> saved. If saving fails, creating is skipped. If creating fails, save is cancelled.

q: How to observe ONLY 'updated' event in Observer?
o: Define `updated(Model $model)` method in Observer class. Remove other methods if not needed.

q: What is `Model::clearBootedModels()`?
o: Clears the internal static array of booted models. Useful in testing to reset global scopes/events.

q: Explaining Query: `->explain()`?
o: Returns the database engine's explanation of the query plan (MySQL EXPLAIN, etc).

q: What is `sole()`?
o: Retrieves a single record that satisfies the criteria. Fails if 0 or >1 exist.

q: Difference between `find($id)` and `firstWhere('id', $id)`?
o: `find` typically uses primary key optimization directly (shortcuts query builder if possible). `firstWhere` builds a query.

q: How to get the 'raw' array of attributes from a model (ignoring mutators)?
How to get mutated attributes?
o: Access them as properties: `$model->attribute_name` (Eloquent automatically calls accessor).

q: How to check if two models refer to the same database row?
Why `===` might fail for two model instances of same row?
o: Because they are different objects in memory (unless using singleton/repository caching). `is()` checks keys/table.

q: What is `Model::setAppends([])`?
o: Overrides the `$appends` array at runtime for the instance (e.g. to disable appending accessors for serialization).

q: How to limit eager loaded results?
o: Complex. Typically requires a subquery or `map` logic. `with` closures cannot effectively use `limit` on `hasMany` (N+1 limit problem).

q: What package solves N+1 limit problem?
o: staudenmeir/eloquent-eager-limit is a popular community package.

q: Does `Model::all()` support columns?
How to use `cursor` in a `foreach`?
What is `Model::withoutTouching()`?
o: Executes code block without updating `updated_at` on the model or its relations.

q: How to check if model uses `HasUuids`?
What is `Model::resolveConnection`?
o: Resolves the connection instance (often used internally).

q: How to get the 'foreign key' name used by `belongsTo`?
What is `HasTimestamps` trait?
Can you disable timestamps for a single model instance?
What is `Model::unguarded(callback)`?
o: Runs the callback with mass assignment protection disabled.

q: Difference between `make` and `create` in Factory?
o: Make returns instance(s) without saving. Create saves to DB.

q: Factory: `raw` method?
How to force a specific ID when using factory?
What is `ensureHelperLoaded`?
o: Internal method/concept, irrelevant... Actually, `ensure` methods on `PendingRequest`? No. In Eloquent: `ensureFactory`? No. Trick question.

q: How to use `having` clause in Eloquent?
When do you need `having` vs `where`?
o: Having filters AFTER grouping (aggregates). Where filters BEFORE grouping.

q: What is `havingRaw`?
How to increment a column value?
Can `increment` take an amount?
Can `increment` update other columns simultaneously?
o: Yes, 3rd argument is array of extra columns. `increment('votes', 1, ['updated_at' => now()])`.

q: What is `decrement`?
How to check if a model attribute is NULL in DB (via accessor context)?
Does `firstOrCreate` match `$fillable` logic?
o: It checks existence with first array, creates with merged first+second array. Requires fillable for keys.

q: What is `updateOrCreate`?
o: Checks if record exists matching first array. If yes, updates with second array. If no, creates with matched+second array.

q: What is `Model::Reguard`?
o: Re-enables mass assignment protection after unguarding.

q: Does Eloquent support 'spatial' data types?
o: Yes, mostly via `casts` to specific classes or using raw queries/packages (e.g. grimzy/laravel-mysql-spatial). Native support is improving.

q: What is the `new` keyword doing in `new Model`?
o: Instantiates the class in memory. No DB connection yet until save/query.

q: How to change the primary key type to string in model?
